DOCNAME: CASE OF TANRIKOLU AND OTHERS v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 6-3-c;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic and Convention proceedings

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the applicants were taken into police custody in Silopi by policemen on suspicion of aiding and abetting an illegal organisation , namely the ORG .
CARDINAL . At the end of their police custody , the applicants were brought before ORG and were subsequently placed in detention on remand .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the public prosecutor at ORG filed a bill of indictment . He accused the applicants of aiding and abetting an illegal organisation , and called for them to be sentenced pursuant to LAW .
CARDINAL . The applicants were all released pending trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , which was composed of CARDINAL judges including a military judge , found the applicants guilty as charged and sentenced them to different terms of imprisonment , ranging DATE .

CARDINAL . A full description of the domestic law may be found in PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
